intro: Orchis × penzigiana nothosubsp. sardoa, commonly known as the Sardinian orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to the island of Sardinia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and exhibits typical orchid characteristics such as a single, showy flower with a distinctive lip. The plant has a short, underground rhizome and produces a single erect stem with a few leaves. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color, with a complex structure that includes a spurred labellum. This nothosubspecies is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique genetic makeup and limited distribution.
